titlestmt.titleproper: Asia Society photographs and special formats
A Guide to the Asia Society photographs and special formats FA105

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-09-30 00:02:49 -0400.

did.unittitle: Asia Society photographs and special formats

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection restricted from scholarly research, pending further archival processing.

RAC is unable to provide access to obsolete media and original digital media. In addition separated media may not yet have undergone stabilization procedures. When feasible, a digital surrogate may be created via special order. All applicable charges will apply. See RAC Head of Archival Services or RAC Head of Digital Programs for details.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed films, only available in their original film format.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view films -- please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1902).
If the item does not have a designated AV number, please refer to the Title and the Film Number (which consists of a combination of Roman numerals and alphanumerics - example: III 14.1-6).

physdesc.extent: Tassilo Adam film collection encompasses approximately 25,000 feet of film on 49 reels. The collection includes 35 negatives and 14 prints in 16mm and 35mm formats.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tassilo Adam (1878-1955) was a German-born ethnographer who was appointed the official Ethnologist of the Dutch East Indies by the Governor General of Java. He was a photographer and amateur filmmaker with an anthropological and documentary approach to the Indonesian culture he captured on film. From 1929-1955, Adam was the curator of Oriental Art at the Brooklyn Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tassilo Adam film collection encompasses approximately 25,000 feet of film on 49 reels. The collection includes 35 negatives and 14 prints in 16mm and 35mm formats.

The documentary footage was shot in Indonesia from 1921-1928 of dances, shadow play, dramatic dance, religious processions, wedding festivals in the palaces, and other ceremonies as well as dance finery, costumes of the Javanese nobles, everyday wear and dance attire. The bulk of the collection is of Central Java, comprising of court ceremonies and dances at the palaces of Jogyakarta and Surakarta, as well as village performances and rituals in the surrounding area.
Highlights of the collection include the films that capture
• Wayang Wong, a type of classical Javanese dance theatrical performance with themes taken from episodes of the Ramayana or Mahabharata
• Wayang Topeng, a Javanese theatrical performance in which performers wear masks.
• Kuda Kepang or Kuda Lumping, a traditional Javanese dance depicting a group of horsemen.

• Serimpi, a classical dance of Cental Java associated with royal palaces of Yogyakarta and Surakarta. The dance epitomizes the character of the royal court, and the dance became an important symbol of the ruler’s power as well as the refinement of Javanese culture.

• Bedoyo dances, is a ritualized dance of Java and is associated with the royal palaces of Yogyakarta and Surakarta. The dance epitomizes the character of the royal court, and the dance became an important symbol of the ruler’s power.
• Wayang Kulit, a Javanese shadow puppet theatrical performance
• Gamelan, a traditional orchestra of Java and Bali in Indonesia, made up predominantly of percussive instruments.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black and white, 28 minutes. Available on 16mm film. Condition is okay. There is a slight odor and film stock alters between single and double perforation.
did.materialspec: 16mm acetate film base, 1005 feet.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scenes of male/female couple dancing with a band in the background, male/female dancers modeling their costume and head gear. Includes Reel 8 (Java). Procession of community bringing gifts, soldiers at shooting practice, intertitles about children as little soldiers, footage of the Susuhunan, archers, the golden throne. Includes "Painter Speis". Footage of animal costume, parachute/hot air balloon, people bringing statues to the mountain, crowd carrying cone shaped monuments down the street. Includes "Court DJO-VG Karta". Includes scenes of elders modeling wardrobes and hats, albino villager. Intertitles about the Sultan's officials, Eldest Pangeran, Assistant Resident, His Highness the Sultan of Jogjakarta, Hamangku Buwono III, Gooningans (gifts).

did.physdesc: Silent, Black and white, 23 minutes. Available on 16mm format. Condition is okay. Film smells of vinegar syndrome.
did.materialspec: 16mm acetate film base, 853 feet.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes footage of hand motions and dancing, possible theatrical storytelling related to battles and fighting, footage of procession as extravogent carriage arrives, temple on a mountain, soldiers in shooting practice, community meeting presenting gifts to a leader, wayang shadow puppet show, gamelon orchestra accompanys wayang performance, young women posing and laughing in front of the camera, and additional footage of women dancing and rehearsing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Footage of warriors in traditional costume dress. Children excerising by jumping over walls and dancing to gongs. Includes scenes of warrior dance, chiefs, ironmongs, making cloth, bathing a baby, female making flour, kids playing a ballgame, chief and warriors assembled, kids going to school, carrying water, four men making flour, cutting coconuts, greeting people, man getting lip cut, warriors marching and dancing, showing fighting technique, village assembly and butchering.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black and white, 38 minutes. Available on 16mm film. Condition is okay. Film has many splices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scenes of dignitaries saying goodbye then driving off, village buildings and surroundings, communal cooking practices, woodworking, metalworking, village manufacturing, bowlmaking. Villagers show off their handiwork, parade procession, seaside, villagers take posessions out to the water, villagers showing interest and curiosity about the camera, dancers display head dress, musicans playing. Community gathers to see variety of performances by adults and children. Footage of animal costumes, performers showing off faces and makeup, child performers, children swimmining in a pool, young men as scouts being watched by a crowd, parachute/hot air balloon, outfits of soldiers, crowd carrying pyramids with military fanfare.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Java Reel 5-8. Footage of landscapes, hiking through the mountains, warriors holding lances, person in traditional dress displaying self for camera, processions, soldiers marching, practicing dancing, markets and trading with women. Women in traditional dress trading, washing fabric, dancing with an assembly of instruments, modeling traditional dance amd fashion, parade of people bearing gifts/treasures and rifle practice. Intertitle in Dutch "Americans on the Road to Surabaya for celebration."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Java Reel 1-4. Includes Dutch intertitles. Footage of female dancers, sports activities such as chariot racing, guests arriving at a party, agriculutural practices, craftmanship, metalworking, volcano, two villagers showing off personal items. Dolls on mountain tops watching over the spirits of human sacrifices, community at beach playing in water, processions, limestone cliffs, marching soldiers. Footage off shore in a commerical boat, footage of Pieter Corneliszoon Hooft steamship with passagers waiting to board, a woman showing off her baby in a wrap on the dock, and view of the coast and shipping years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel includes Asia Roll 9, Java Roll 10, 11, 12. Asia Roll 9 includes scenes of musicans playing instruments, warriors dancing and Indonesia horse dance. Java Roll 10 includes parade footage,and a wayang performance accompanied with gamelan orchestra. Java Roll 11 includes scenes of a parade, village life and open market. Java Roll 12 contains scenes of Javanese coast and men bringing a boat into the water.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Islamic marriage ceremony of Indonesian Ambassador Dr. Sunario's ward Indrawati Roosheroe to engineer Nondon Gandjar, at the Ambassador's residence in Hampstead London, England in 1959. Scenes of people congratulating the bride and groom, having refreshments outside, ceremonial dance of two women performed in traditional attire, bride feeding her groom with a small ball of rice and tradition of foot washing is performed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A film produced by the Korean Film Unit in 1975 of the excavation of the Northern Tomb in Silla, one of the three ancient kingdoms of Korea. The film showcases historical archaeology of Korea, ancient burial practices, excavating artifacts such as bronzeware, pottery, jewerly and royal crowns. The cleaning and preservation practices of the archeologists is emphasized.

did.unittitle: Wayang Kulit (the Shadow Puppet Theatre of Java)
did.physdesc: Sound, Color, 22 minutes. Avaiable on 16mm. Condition is okay. There is a slight odor and color has faded to red.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A visual exploration of Wayang Kulit, the shadow puppet theater of Indonesia. A documentary showing scenes from an all-night performance of wayang kulit play, with behind-the-scene views of the dalang (puppeteer) manipulating the puppets as well as views from the audience side of the screen. Includes demonstration of how a puppet is carved and explanation of its characteristics and a showcase of a gamelan orchestra. Narrator, Murati Waghudi; puppeteer, Dalang, Oemartopo; gamelan, Kyai Kumbal. Produced and directed by Baylis Glascock. Copyright 1970, Samuel H. Scripps Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A 1961 dramatization presented by Bell Systems on the future of technology and telecommunications. The film breaks into two parts. Part I: the problems of the present, and part II: the way those problems could be solved by the technology of the future. Technology presented in this film include wireless Bellboy Pager, the Data-phone, videophone, card-reading phone or automatic dialer, and drone delivery systems via rocket. Written by Jerome Alden, produced by Henry Strauss and directed by Robert Wilmot. Copyright 1961, American Telephone and Telegraph Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A program from UHF New York City Channel 31 Lee Graham Interviews. First segment: Lee Graham interviews the executive director of the Asia Society Paul C. Sherbert regarding the historical background, mission and educational purposes of the Asia Society. Second segment: A South Indian Napalese dance is performance. Third segment: Lee Graham interviews Virginia Field, assistant director to the Art Gallery at Asia House discusses art exhibitions and Asian artists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A 1944 film produced by John Ford of the wartime mission to the Chinese Communists in their headquarters. Shot by OSS operatives in wartime China, this is the story of their visit to Chinese cCommunist headquarters in Japanese-occupied China during World War II. Features Mao Tze-Dung, Cho En-lai.
